Metadata: Fuscosides A-D: antiinflammator​y diterpenoid glycosides of new structural classes from the Caribbean gorgonian "Eunicea fusca"

Marine octocorals of the order Gorgonacea, the sea whips and sea fans (phylum Cnidaria) are abundant, chemically-rich invertebrates found in the reef and shallow-water habitats of the Caribbean Sea. Four new diterpenoid arabinose glycosides, fuscosides A and D, have been isolated from the Caribbean gorgonian "Eunicea fusca." Fuscosides A and B are effective topical antiinflammator​y agents with potencies equivalent to indomethacin and manoalide. Fuscoside B selectively inhibits the synthesis of leukotrienes LTB4 and LTC4, but not PGE2, in the mouse peritoneal macrophage, suggesting it is a selective inhibitor of leukotriene synthesis.
